transportAdvice: Kochi has a metro rail system that connects key areas of the city, and an extensive local bus network covers most tourist zones, though buses can be crowded during peak hours. Auto-rickshaws and taxis are widely available for shorter trips, and the historic Fort Kochi area is compact enough to explore comfortably on foot or by bicycle.

weather.description: Pleasant and dry with warm sunny days, making it one of the best months to visit Kochi.
Warm and largely dry with comfortable evenings, ideal for sightseeing and outdoor activities.
Temperatures begin to climb and humidity rises slightly, but conditions remain mostly dry and manageable.
Hot and increasingly humid with occasional pre-monsoon showers beginning to appear toward month's end.
The southwest monsoon arrives, bringing heavy and frequent rainfall that can disrupt outdoor plans.
Peak monsoon month with persistent heavy rain, lush green landscapes, and significantly reduced tourist crowds.
Monsoon continues in full force with near-daily downpours; indoor cultural attractions are a better focus.
Still firmly in monsoon season with heavy rain and high humidity, though the greenery is spectacular.
Rainfall begins to ease slightly toward the end of the month but conditions remain wet and humid.
The northeast monsoon brings intermittent showers; weather is transitional and can be unpredictable.
Rain becomes less frequent and conditions improve noticeably, marking the start of the tourist season.
Dry, warm, and pleasant with comfortable humidity levels, making it a peak month for visitors.
